canonical_explanation.text: Air is all around us but we cannot see it. We need air to breathe and live. All living things need air. Moving air is called wind. Wind helps fly kites, dry clothes, and turn windmills. Clean air is good for us. Smoke and dust make air dirty. We should keep air clean by planting trees.
rules: Air is all around us but we cannot see it.
We need air to breathe and live.
Clean air is healthy, dirty air (smoke, dust) is unhealthy.

questions.explanation_correct: No, we cannot see air. Air is all around us, but it is invisible. We can't see air because it is clear and doesn't have any color.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is invisible, so we cannot see it. Even though we can't see air, we know it is there because we need it to breathe and live. Air helps us do many things, like fly kites and turn windmills, but we can't see the air itself.

questions.explanation_correct: Air is all around us, not just in the sky or outside. We can't see air, but it is everywhere - in our homes, schools, and even inside our bodies. Air is important for us to breathe and live.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is not only found in the sky or outside. It is all around us, everywhere, even inside our homes and schools. We need air to breathe and live, and it is not just found in bottles or containers.

questions.explanation_correct: A balloon is filled with air. We cannot see air, but it is all around us and fills up the balloon. This makes the balloon float up in the air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water, milk, and sand cannot fill up a balloon. These liquids and solids are too heavy and will not make the balloon float up. Only air, which is light and all around us, can fill up and lift a balloon.

questions.explanation_correct: We need air to breathe because air has the special gas called oxygen. Our body needs oxygen to function and stay alive. Without air, we cannot breathe and we will not be able to live.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not need air to eat, sleep, or play. Air is important because it helps us breathe and stay alive. Breathing is the most important reason we need air.

questions.explanation_correct: All living things, including humans, animals, and plants, need air to live. Air has important gases like oxygen that all living things need to breathe and survive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Humans, animals, and plants all need air to live. They need air to breathe and get the oxygen they need. Air is important for all living things, not just for some of them.

questions.explanation_correct: Birds can fly because of the air around them. Air helps birds stay up in the sky and move their wings to fly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is the right answer because air helps birds stay up in the sky and move their wings to fly. Water, fire, and ground do not help birds fly. Water would make birds sink, fire would hurt them, and the ground would not let them stay up in the air.

questions.explanation_correct: Moving air is called wind. When air moves around, it is called wind. Wind helps fly kites and turn windmills.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rain, sun, and water are not moving air. Only wind is moving air. Wind is the correct answer because it is the air that is moving and helping us do things like fly kites.

questions.explanation_correct: Wind helps a kite fly. Wind blows the kite up into the sky and keeps it flying.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water, fire, and rain do not help a kite fly. The wind is what makes a kite go up and stay in the air. The wind blows on the kite's special shape and lifts it up.

questions.explanation_correct: The wind and sun help dry wet clothes because they blow air and provide heat to evaporate the water in the clothes. Moving air (wind) and warmth from the sun work together to dry the clothes quickly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The wind and sun are the right answers because they help dry wet clothes. Water, rain, and darkness would not help dry clothes - in fact, water and rain would make the clothes even wetter! The wind blows air and the sun provides warmth, which work together to evaporate the water from the wet clothes.

questions.explanation_correct: Wind turns the windmill. Wind is moving air, and it pushes the blades of the windmill, making them spin around. This makes the windmill work and turn.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water, fire, and hands cannot turn a windmill. Only the wind can do that. The wind blows and pushes the blades of the windmill, causing it to spin around and work.

questions.question_text: Which air is good for us?
questions.explanation_correct: Clean air is good for us because it helps us breathe and stay healthy. We need clean air to live and grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dirty air, smoky air, and dusty air are not good for us. They can make us sick and have trouble breathing. We should always try to keep the air clean by planting more trees.

questions.explanation_correct: Smoke and dust make air dirty. They can make the air we breathe unhealthy and bad for us. We should try to keep the air clean by reducing smoke and dust.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees, water, and plants do not make air dirty. In fact, trees and plants help clean the air by producing fresh, clean oxygen for us to breathe. Only smoke and dust can make the air dirty and unhealthy.

questions.explanation_correct: Trees give us clean air because they take in the dirty air (like smoke) and give out clean, fresh air that we can breathe. This helps keep the air around us clean and healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vehicles and factories make the air dirty by releasing smoke and dust. Smoke is not good for us and makes the air unclean. Trees, on the other hand, help keep the air clean by taking in the dirty air and releasing fresh, clean air that we can breathe easily.

questions.question_text: You blow air into a balloon. What happens?
questions.explanation_correct: When you blow air into a balloon, the balloon gets bigger. This is because the air you blow into the balloon fills up the inside and makes the balloon expand, or get bigger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The balloon gets bigger because the air you blow into it fills up the inside and makes the balloon expand. The balloon does not shrink, disappear, or stay the same. Blowing air into a balloon makes it bigger, not smaller or the same size.

questions.question_text: What happens if we cannot breathe?
questions.explanation_correct: If we cannot breathe, we cannot live. Air is very important for all living things to survive. We need air to breathe and stay alive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A 'Nothing' is wrong because not being able to breathe is a big problem. Option B 'We feel hungry' is wrong because not being able to breathe is more serious than just feeling hungry. Option D 'We sleep' is wrong because not being able to breathe would make us unable to stay alive, not just fall asleep.

questions.question_text: On a very windy day, what happens to leaves?
questions.explanation_correct: On a windy day, the leaves move and fly because the strong wind blows them. Wind is moving air, and it can make leaves and other light things move and fly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The leaves do not stay still on a windy day. The wind, which is moving air, blows the leaves and makes them move and fly around. They do not grow bigger or turn red on a windy day.

questions.question_text: Why do we feel cool when wind blows?
questions.explanation_correct: When the wind blows, it moves the air around us. The moving air helps cool our body by taking away the heat from our skin. This is why we feel cool when the wind blows.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A 'Wind is very cold' is not correct because wind itself is not cold. Option C 'Wind brings ice' is also not correct as wind does not bring ice. Option D 'Wind is wet' is not correct because wind is not wet, it is just moving air. The correct answer is Option B 'Moving air cools us' because the movement of air helps take away the heat from our body, making us feel cool.

questions.question_text: What should we do to keep air clean?
questions.explanation_correct: We should plant trees to keep the air clean. Trees take in bad air (carbon dioxide) and make good air (oxygen) that we can breathe. This helps keep the air clean and healthy for us to live in.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We should not cut trees or burn garbage, as this makes the air dirty with smoke and dust. Driving more cars also makes the air dirty. The right thing to do is to plant more trees, as they help clean the air by making good oxygen for us to breathe.

questions.explanation_correct: Bubbles in water show that air is in the water. When air gets trapped in water, it forms bubbles. This shows that air is present in the water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bubbles in water do not show that the water is hot or cold. Bubbles form when air gets trapped in the water, not because of the temperature of the water. The correct answer is that bubbles in water show that air is in the water.

questions.explanation_correct: Vehicles like cars, buses, and trucks make air dirty by releasing smoke and dust. This makes the air around us dirty and bad for our health.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vehicles do not make the air clean, sweet, or colorful. They release smoke and dust that makes the air dirty and unhealthy for us to breathe. So the correct answer is that vehicles make the air dirty.

questions.question_text: What do tires need to stay full?
questions.explanation_correct: Tires need air to stay full and not go flat. Air is pumped into the tires to keep them inflated and working properly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tires do not need water, food, or oil to stay full. They need air, which is pumped into the tires to keep them inflated and working properly. Air is all around us, and we need it to breathe and live. Moving air is called wind, which helps us fly kites and dry our clothes.

questions.question_text: On a calm day with no wind, can you fly a kite easily?
questions.explanation_correct: No, you cannot fly a kite easily on a calm day with no wind. Kites need wind to fly up in the air. Without any wind, there is not enough air moving to lift the kite up.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When there is no wind, the air is calm and still. Kites need the air to move in order to fly up. If there is no wind, the kite will not be able to fly easily. You need a breezy day with some wind to be able to fly a kite successfully.

questions.explanation_correct: Air takes up space because it is all around us, even though we can't see it. Air is a gas, and all gases take up space.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air does not take up no space or only a little space. Air is a gas that fills the whole area around us. It takes up a lot of space, even though we can't see it. The correct answer is that air takes up space.

questions.question_text: Fish also need air. How do they get it?
questions.explanation_correct: Fish get air from the water they live in. They have special organs called gills that help them take in the air (oxygen) dissolved in the water and use it to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fish do not get air from trees, food, or the sun. They live in water and get the air (oxygen) they need to breathe from the water around them. Their gills help them take in this air from the water.

questions.explanation_correct: Dirty air is called air pollution. When the air has a lot of smoke, dust, and other things that make it dirty, it is called air pollution. This is bad for our health and the environment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A) Pollution. Dirty air is not called 'fresh', 'good', or 'healthy' air. It is called air pollution because it has a lot of smoke, dust, and other things that make it dirty and bad for us to breathe.

questions.explanation_correct: Wind can be either gentle or strong. This is because wind is just the movement of air, and air can move in different ways - sometimes it's light and gentle, and sometimes it's strong and powerful.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wind is not always just one way. It can be gentle, like a soft breeze, or it can be strong, like a heavy storm. The correct answer is that wind can be both gentle and strong, not just one or the other.

questions.question_text: If you wave your hand fast, what do you feel?
questions.explanation_correct: When you wave your hand fast, you feel the air moving. This is because the fast movement of your hand pushes the air around, and you can feel the air moving against your hand.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'air moving'. You cannot feel water or fire when you wave your hand fast. The air around us is always moving, even if we can't see it. When you move your hand quickly, you can feel the air moving against your hand.

questions.explanation_correct: We breathe air through our nose. The nose is the part of our body that takes in air so we can breathe and live.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not breathe air through our eyes, ears, or hands. The nose is the part of our body that we use to breathe in air. When we inhale, the air goes through our nose and into our lungs, which helps us to live and grow.

questions.question_text: When there is too much smoke, it becomes hard to ___.
questions.explanation_correct: When there is too much smoke in the air, it becomes hard to breathe. This is because the smoke makes the air dirty and difficult to inhale, which can make it hard to get enough air into our lungs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is C) Breathe. When there is too much smoke in the air, it becomes hard to breathe because the smoke makes the air dirty and hard to take in. The smoke can also make it difficult to see clearly, but the main problem is that it becomes hard to get enough air into our lungs.

questions.question_text: A fan blows air to make us feel ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A fan blows air, which makes us feel cool and refreshed. This is because the moving air from the fan helps our bodies cool down and feel more comfortable.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A fan blows air, which makes us feel cool and refreshed, not hot. The moving air from the fan helps our bodies cool down and feel more comfortable, which is why option B is the correct answer.

questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'Air is all around us' is true because we can feel the air around us even though we cannot see it. Air surrounds us everywhere, even though it is invisible.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'Air is all around us' is true because we need air to breathe and live. All living things, including us, need air to survive. We cannot see air, but it is present everywhere around us.

questions.explanation_correct: We cannot see air because it is invisible. Air is all around us, but it does not have a color or shape that we can see.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people think we can see air because we can see wind blowing things, like trees and flags. But the air itself is invisible. We can only see the effects of air, not the air itself.

questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we need air to breathe because air has the gas called oxygen that our bodies need to live. We cannot live without air and oxygen.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, that is not correct. All living things, including humans, need air to breathe and stay alive. We cannot live without air because our bodies need the special gas called oxygen that is found in air.

questions.explanation_correct: Yes, that's right! Moving air is called wind. Wind is the movement of air around us, and we can feel the wind blowing and see it move things like leaves and kites.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, that's not correct. Moving air is always called wind. Wind is the movement of air, and we can feel it and see it move things around us. Air is all around us, even though we can't see it. All living things need air to breathe and live.

questions.explanation_correct: Wind helps fly kites because the moving air (wind) pushes the kite up and keeps it flying in the sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wind does not stop kites from flying. In fact, wind is needed to make kites go up in the air. The moving air pushes the kite up and keeps it flying high.

questions.explanation_correct: Smoke makes air dirty and not clean. Smoke is a type of air pollution that can be harmful to our health.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smoke is not good for air. It makes the air dirty and polluted. Smoke comes from things like fires and factories, and it can make it hard for us to breathe clean, fresh air. We should try to avoid smoke and keep the air clean by planting more trees.

questions.explanation_correct: Trees give us clean air because they take in bad air (carbon dioxide) and release good air (oxygen) that we can breathe. This helps keep the air around us clean and fresh.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people might think that trees do not give us clean air because they cannot see the air or the oxygen that trees release. But trees are actually very important for keeping the air clean by removing bad air and giving us good air to breathe.

questions.explanation_correct: Plants need air to live and grow. Just like humans and animals, plants use air to make their food and energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do need air to live and grow. All living things, including plants, need air to survive. Plants use air to make their food and energy through a process called photosynthesis.

questions.explanation_correct: Yes, balloons are filled with air. When we blow into a balloon, we are adding air inside it, which makes the balloon expand and float up.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people may think that balloons are not filled with air, but this is not correct. Balloons are actually containers that hold air inside them. When we blow into a balloon, we are adding more air to it, which makes the balloon expand and float up.

questions.question_text: Dirty air is good for health.
questions.explanation_correct: Dirty air is not good for health. Dirty air with smoke and dust can make us sick and hurt our lungs. We should keep the air clean by planting more trees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dirty air is not good for our health. Smoke and dust in the air can make it hard for us to breathe and make us feel sick. We need clean, fresh air to stay healthy and strong.

questions.question_text: ___ is all around us but we cannot see it.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is 'Air' because air is the invisible gas that surrounds us everywhere on Earth. We cannot see air, but we know it is there because we need it to breathe and live.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not 'Smoke' or 'Dust' because those are not all around us. The answer is 'Air' because air is the invisible gas that surrounds us everywhere. We need air to breathe and live, even though we cannot see it.

questions.explanation_correct: We need air to breathe because air has oxygen, which is the gas that helps our bodies work. Breathing air keeps us alive and healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not need air to see. Even though air is all around us, we cannot see it. The correct answer is that we need air to breathe, which means to take air into our lungs and let it out. Breathing air is very important for living things like us.

questions.explanation_correct: Moving air is called wind. We can feel the wind blowing, and it helps move things like kites and windmills.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'wind'. Moving air is called wind. You cannot see air, but you can feel the wind blowing. Wind is important because it helps us fly kites and dry our clothes.

questions.explanation_correct: Wind helps fly a kite because it blows the kite up into the air. When the wind blows, it pushes against the kite and makes it fly up into the sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is 'Wind'. Wind is the moving air around us. When the wind blows, it pushes against the kite and makes it fly up. The correct answer should be written as 'Wind' in the blank.

questions.explanation_correct: Smoke makes air dirty because it adds small particles and chemicals to the air that we breathe. Smoke from things like factories and cars can make the air look foggy and less clean.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'dirty'. Smoke is a type of air pollution that makes the air unclean and unhealthy to breathe. The answer should be filled in as 'dirty' to match the exact format expected.

questions.explanation_correct: Trees give us clean air because they take in the bad air (carbon dioxide) and give out the good air (oxygen) that we need to breathe. Trees help keep the air clean and fresh for us to live.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Trees'. Trees help clean the air around us by taking in the dirty air and giving out clean, fresh air that we can breathe. They do this through a process called photosynthesis. Without trees, the air would be dirty and full of smoke and dust, which is not good for us to breathe.

questions.explanation_correct: A balloon is filled with air because air is all around us and we need air to breathe. When we fill a balloon with air, it expands and floats up in the sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The balloon is not filled with smoke or dust. It is filled with air, which is invisible but all around us. Air helps balloons float up in the sky. The correct answer is 'air'.

questions.explanation_correct: All living things need air to breathe and live. Air is all around us, and we need it to survive and be healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The missing word in the sentence is 'air'. All living things, including plants, animals, and humans, need air to breathe and stay alive. Without air, they cannot live. The correct answer is 'air'.

questions.explanation_correct: Wind helps dry wet clothes because the moving air can evaporate the water from the clothes, making them dry faster.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'dry'. Wind helps dry wet clothes by blowing air over the clothes, which helps the water in the clothes evaporate and become dry. The moving air from the wind is what helps remove the wetness from the clothes.

questions.explanation_correct: Dirty air with smoke, dust, and other things mixed in it is called air pollution. This makes the air we breathe dirty and unhealthy. We need to keep the air clean by planting trees and avoiding things that cause air pollution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer 'pollution' is correct because air pollution refers to the dirty air around us that has smoke, dust, and other unhealthy things mixed in it. Air pollution makes the air we breathe dirty and bad for our health. We should try to keep the air clean by planting more trees and avoiding things that cause air pollution.

questions.explanation_correct: A windmill uses wind to turn. The blades of the windmill spin when the wind blows, and this spinning motion helps to generate electricity or power other machinery.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'windmill'. A windmill is a machine that uses the power of the wind to turn its blades. The spinning blades of the windmill can then be used to generate electricity or power other machines. So a windmill is the correct answer to the question 'A ___ uses wind to turn'.

questions.explanation_correct: We breathe air through our nose because that is the way our body is designed to take in air. The nose helps clean and warm the air before it goes into our lungs, which is important for keeping us healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'nose'. We do not breathe air through our ears or mouth, we breathe it through our nose. The nose is the special part of our body that allows us to take in air and send it to our lungs so we can live and be healthy.

questions.question_text: Put in order: Blowing up a balloon.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is 'Get balloon, Blow air in, Balloon gets big' because to blow up a balloon, you first need to get the balloon, then you need to blow air into it, and finally the balloon will get bigger as you blow more air into it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be 'Balloon gets big, Get balloon, Blow air in'. This is wrong because you cannot blow up a balloon if you don't have the balloon first. You need to get the balloon before you can blow air into it, and then the balloon will get bigger as you blow more air into it.

questions.question_text: Put in order: Flying a kite.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is correct because the wind blows first, which makes the kite go up. Then the kite can fly high in the sky. The wind is needed to lift the kite up and make it fly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order should be: Wind blows, Kite goes up, Kite flies high. The wind must blow first to lift the kite up into the air. Once the kite is up, it can then fly high in the sky. The kite cannot fly high without the wind blowing to lift it up first.

questions.explanation_correct: First we wash the clothes, then hang them outside on a line, and the wind blows on them to dry them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Think about what happens step by step when we dry clothes â€” we wash them first, then hang them so the wind can dry them.

questions.question_text: Put in order: How trees clean air.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is 'Dirty air around, Trees take it, Give clean air' because trees help clean the dirty air around us. They take in the dirty air and give us clean air that we can breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be 'Trees take it, Dirty air around, Give clean air' because it does not show the full process. First, there is dirty air around us. Then, the trees take in that dirty air. Finally, the trees give us clean air that is good for us to breathe.

questions.question_text: Put in order: How we breathe.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: 'Air goes in nose, Fills our lungs, We breathe out'. This is how we breathe. Air first goes in through our nose, then fills up our lungs, and finally we breathe out the used air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: 'We breathe out, Air goes in nose, Fills our lungs'. This is wrong because air first goes in through the nose, then fills up our lungs, and only after that we breathe out the used air. The right order is 'Air goes in nose, Fills our lungs, We breathe out'.

questions.question_text: How is air different from water in the way we can see them?

options.text: Air cannot be seen but water can be seen
Water cannot be seen but air can be seen

questions.explanation_correct: Air cannot be seen because it is invisible. But water can be seen in a glass, in a river, or in rain. This is one big difference between air and water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is invisible, so we cannot see it. But water is something we can see in a glass, in a pond, or when it rains. They are different because air is invisible but water is visible.

questions.question_text: How does a windy day differ from a calm day in what happens to leaves on a tree?

options.text: Leaves shake on a windy day but stay still on a calm day
Leaves fall off on both days
Leaves stay still on a windy day but shake on a calm day
Leaves grow bigger on a windy day

questions.explanation_correct: On a windy day, moving air pushes the leaves and they shake and move. On a calm day there is very little moving air, so leaves stay still. Wind makes the difference.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wind is moving air. On a windy day the moving air pushes leaves and makes them shake. On a calm day the air is still, so leaves do not move much. Leaves do not grow bigger or fall off just because of wind.

questions.question_text: How does the air near a garden differ from the air near a factory in how clean it is?

options.text: Both have the same clean air
Air near a garden is cleaner because trees clean the air
Air near a factory is cleaner because machines clean the air

questions.explanation_correct: Air near a garden is cleaner because trees and plants take in dirty air and give out clean air. A factory releases smoke and dust, which makes the air near it dirty.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees and plants in a garden help clean the air by taking in bad air and giving out fresh air. Factories release smoke that makes the air dirty. So the air near a garden is much cleaner than the air near a factory.

questions.question_text: How does a fan differ from a windmill in what makes them move?

options.text: A fan uses electricity to move air, but a windmill uses wind to turn
A windmill uses electricity and a fan uses wind

questions.explanation_correct: A fan uses electricity to spin and push air towards us. A windmill does not need electricity. The wind blows on it and makes it turn. So they are different in what makes them move.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A fan needs electricity to spin its blades and blow air at us. A windmill does not need electricity. Instead, the wind blows on the windmill blades and makes them turn. So a fan uses electricity but a windmill uses wind.

questions.question_text: How does a fish differ from a dog in the way it gets air to breathe?

options.text: A fish gets air from water using gills, but a dog breathes air through its nose
A dog gets air from water and a fish breathes through its nose

questions.explanation_correct: A fish lives in water and uses special parts called gills to get air from the water. A dog lives on land and breathes air through its nose, just like us. Both need air, but they get it in different ways.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both fish and dogs need air to live, but they get it differently. A fish lives in water and uses gills to get air from the water. A dog breathes air through its nose on land. They do not get air the same way.

questions.question_text: Something is all around us, we cannot see it, and it fills up a balloon when we blow. What is it?
questions.explanation_correct: These clues all describe air. Air is all around us, we cannot see it, and when we blow into a balloon, air fills it up and makes it bigger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water, sand, and milk can all be seen. Only air is invisible, is all around us, and fills a balloon when we blow into it. These clues point to air.

questions.question_text: It moves leaves, dries wet clothes, and flies kites. What is it?
questions.explanation_correct: All these things are done by wind. Wind is moving air. It can move leaves, help dry wet clothes, and push kites up into the sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rain makes things wet, not dry. The sun gives light and heat but does not move leaves or fly kites by itself. Water does not fly kites. Only wind, which is moving air, can do all three things.

questions.question_text: It comes from factories and cars, makes the air dirty, and is bad for breathing. What is it?
questions.explanation_correct: Smoke comes from factories and cars. It makes the air dirty and is bad for our health. When we breathe in smoke, it hurts our body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Clean air is good for us, not dirty. Water does not come out of cars and factories to make air dirty. Wind is just moving air. Smoke is the thing that comes from factories and cars and makes the air dirty and hard to breathe.

questions.question_text: It takes in dirty air, gives out clean air, and helps keep the air fresh. What is it?
questions.explanation_correct: A tree takes in dirty air and gives out clean, fresh air. Trees help keep the air around us clean. That is why planting trees is good for the air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A car and a factory release smoke that makes air dirty. A fan just moves air around but does not clean it. Only a tree takes in dirty air and gives out clean air to keep the air fresh.

questions.question_text: Riya and her father go to the park to fly a kite. But the air is very still and calm. What will happen to the kite?

options.text: The kite will fly very high
The kite will not go up easily because there is no wind
The kite will fly faster than usual
The kite will turn into a bird

questions.explanation_correct: Kites need wind to fly. Wind is moving air. If the air is still and calm, there is no wind to push the kite up. So Riya's kite will not go up easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Without wind, a kite cannot fly. Wind is moving air that pushes the kite up into the sky. On a calm day with no wind, the kite has nothing to lift it up. It will not fly high or fast without wind.

questions.question_text: Amit walks near a factory. He sees lots of smoke coming out. He starts coughing. Why is Amit coughing?

options.text: Because the air near the factory is dirty from smoke
Because the air near the factory is too clean
Because he drank too much water
Because the sun is too bright

questions.explanation_correct: Amit is coughing because the smoke from the factory has made the air dirty. Dirty air with smoke is hard to breathe and makes people cough. This is air pollution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Amit is not coughing because of clean air, water, or the sun. The smoke from the factory makes the air dirty and unhealthy. When we breathe dirty air with smoke, it hurts our lungs and makes us cough.

questions.question_text: Priya puts her pet goldfish in a bowl of water. The fish moves its mouth open and shut in the water. What is the fish doing?

options.text: Getting air from the water to breathe

questions.explanation_correct: The fish is getting air from the water to breathe. Fish need air just like we do, but they get air from the water using their gills. All living things need air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The fish is not talking or just drinking water. Fish open and close their mouths to take water in and pass it over their gills. The gills take air from the water so the fish can breathe. All living things need air to live.

questions.question_text: Arjun blows air into a paper bag and then pops it with his hands. He hears a loud sound. What came out of the bag when it popped?
questions.explanation_correct: Air came out of the bag when Arjun popped it. He had blown air into the bag, and the air was trapped inside. When the bag popped, the air rushed out and made a loud sound.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Arjun blew air into the bag. Air takes up space inside the bag. When he popped the bag, the trapped air rushed out very fast and made a loud sound. It was not water, dust, or nothing. It was air.

questions.question_text: Meera hangs her wet towel outside on a sunny, windy day. After some time the towel is dry. What helped dry the towel?
questions.explanation_correct: The wind and sun helped dry Meera's towel. Wind is moving air that blows away the wetness, and the sun gives heat. Together they dried the wet towel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rain would make the towel more wet, not dry. Darkness and cold do not help dry things quickly. More water would also make it wetter. The wind blows moving air over the towel and the sun gives heat, and together they make the towel dry.

questions.question_text: Some children think air is found only outside the house. Why is this wrong?

options.text: Because air is found only in the sky
Because air is everywhere, inside and outside the house
Because air is found only inside the house
Because air is found only in bottles

questions.explanation_correct: Air is not found only outside. Air is everywhere, both inside and outside the house. We can breathe air inside our rooms, in school, and everywhere we go. Air is all around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is not found only in one place. It is everywhere around us, inside our house, outside, in school, and in every room. We breathe air all the time, no matter where we are. So the idea that air is only outside is wrong.

questions.question_text: Some children think only people need air. Why is this wrong?

options.text: Because only animals need air, not people
Because no living thing needs air
Because all living things, including animals and plants, need air too

questions.explanation_correct: It is not just people who need air. All living things need air to live. Animals breathe air, and plants also need air. Dogs, cats, fish, birds, trees, and flowers all need air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is needed by all living things, not just people or just animals or just plants. Humans, animals, and plants all need air to survive. So the idea that only people need air is wrong.

questions.question_text: Some children think burning leaves makes the air cleaner. Why is this wrong?

options.text: Because burning leaves makes smoke, which makes the air dirty
Because burning leaves makes the air smell nice
Because burning leaves gives us clean air
Because burning leaves helps trees grow

questions.explanation_correct: Burning leaves makes smoke. Smoke makes the air dirty and polluted. Dirty air is bad for our health. So burning leaves does not clean the air. It makes the air worse.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Burning anything, including leaves, makes smoke. Smoke is bad for the air. It makes the air dirty and unhealthy to breathe. Burning leaves does not clean the air or help trees grow. It causes air pollution.

questions.question_text: Why do all living things need air and not just humans?

options.text: Because only humans have a nose to breathe
Because all living things need air to stay alive and grow
Because animals and plants do not breathe
Because air is only for people

questions.explanation_correct: All living things, not just humans, need air to stay alive and grow. Animals breathe air through their nose or gills. Plants also use air to make food and grow. Air is for every living thing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is not true that only humans need air. Animals have noses or gills to breathe, and plants also use air. All living things need air to stay alive and grow. That is why air is important for everyone, not just people.

questions.question_text: Why is planting trees a good way to clean the air and not driving more cars?

options.text: Because trees are taller than cars
Because trees take in dirty air and give out clean air, but cars release smoke that makes air dirty
Because trees are green and cars are not

questions.explanation_correct: Trees help clean the air because they take in dirty air and give out clean, fresh air. Cars do the opposite. Cars release smoke from their engines, which makes the air dirty. So planting trees cleans the air, but driving cars makes it dirty.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The reason is not about colour or height or speed. Trees clean the air by taking in bad air and giving out good air. Cars release smoke that makes air dirty and polluted. That is why planting trees is good for the air and more cars are bad for the air.

questions.question_text: Why does wind dry wet clothes faster than still air?

options.text: Because wind is hot like fire
Because moving air blows away the wetness from clothes faster
Because wind is made of water

questions.explanation_correct: Wind is moving air. When air moves over wet clothes, it blows away the wetness much faster. Still air does not move, so it cannot blow the wetness away as quickly. That is why clothes dry faster on a windy day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wind is not hot like fire and is not made of water. The real reason is that wind is moving air. Moving air blows over the wet clothes and takes away the wetness faster. Still air does not move, so clothes take much longer to dry.
